title: March for Health & Science
description: This event is a march organized by multiple health-focused organizations to advocate for science-based public policies and oppose RFK Jr.'s initiatives.
sponsors: Committee to Protect Public Mental Health
Physicians for a National Health Program
raw_text:
RFK Jr. Must Go!
911!
MARCH FOR HEALTH & SCIENCE
Washington DC, November 5 @4PM
[Logos of various organizations, QR Code]
Physicians for a Healthy Democracy
Accountability Journalism Institute
DEFEND PUBLIC HEALTH
NURSES FOR AMERICA
American Public Health Association
Physicians for Social Responsibility
Committee to Protect Health Care
Stand Up for Science
COMMITTEE TO PROTECT PUBLIC MENTAL HEALTH
Physicians for a National Health Program
DOCTORS FOR AMERICA
FREE SPEECH FOR PEOPLE
Roots Action
raw_summary: The flyer announces a protest event, titled "March for Health & Science," scheduled for November 5th at 4 PM in Washington DC. It appears to be organized by various health and advocacy groups aiming to oppose RFK Jr.

title: Corner Protest
description: Join us for positive engagement at the Corner Protest to protect democracy. We the people, right or left, acknowledge the current issues. Participate and express your views.
meeting_location: SW Corner of Drake and College
raw_text:
Join the Corner Protest every Tuesday and Thursday 4:15-5:45 PM
SW Corner of Drake and College in Fort Collins
Positive engagement
PROTECT DEMOCRACY
Right or Left ... we all know this is WRONG!
WE THE PEOPLE
OMG GOP WTF
Thursday, November 6, 2025
4:15 - 5:45 pm
2601 S College Ave, Fort Collins, CO
raw_summary: The image promotes a recurring protest event in Fort Collins, taking place every Tuesday and Thursday, with a specific occurrence on November 6, 2025.

title: Veterans Day Overpass Bannering
description: Join us for an overpass bannering event on Veterans Day to stand with veterans in defending our constitution, streets, and oaths. The event involves displaying banners reading 'No Oath to Trump' on various overpasses in the Olympia-Lacey-Tumwater area.
raw_text: VETERANS 11.11 DAY 2025 NO OATH TO TRUMP 10 AM – 1 PM JOIN US!! OLYMPIA-LACEY-TUMWATER OVERPASS BANNERING 1 TUMWATER PEDESTRIAN BRIDGE / I-5 2 CUSTER WAY / I-5 3 CAPITOL BLVD BRIDGE / I-5 4 EASTSIDE ST. / I-5 5 BOULEVARD RD SE / I-5 6 CHEHALIS-WESTERN TRAIL BRIDGE / I-5 7 SLEATER-KINNEY AVE / I-5 BANNER WITH VETERANS ON HIGHWAY OVERPASSES FROM SEA TO SHINING SEA, STAND WITH VETERANS TO DEFEND OUR CONSTITUTION, OUR STREETS, AND OUR OATHS #NOOATHTOTRUMP #OURSTREETS #VETSAGAINSTTRUMP 501 INDIVISIBLE BACKBONE CAMPAIGN VISIBILITY BRIGADE
raw_summary: The image promotes an overpass bannering event on Veterans Day, November 11, 2025, from 10 AM to 1 PM. It involves banner displays at several overpass locations in the Olympia-Lacey-Tumwater area, with messages opposing taking an oath to Trump. Sponsors include Indivisible, Backbone Campaign, and Visibility Brigade. The flyer emphasizes standing with veterans to defend constitutional values.

title: Nationwide Gathering
description: We invite you to join us in Taos for a nationwide day of honor and respect for our veterans. This event aims to show gratitude and support for our veterans.
address: Paseo del Norte and Kit Carson
meeting_location: Paseo del Norte and Kit Carson
raw_text:
NATIONWIDE GATHERING
In Solidarity with Our Constitution and Veterans
VETERANS DAY 11.11.25
WITH RESPECT, HONOR AND GRATITUDE...
TAOS DAILY POP-UP JOINS NATIONWIDE DAY OF HONOR FOR OUR VETERANS JOIN US!!!
Taos 9AM-10:30AM
Paseo del Norte and Kit Carson
raw_summary: The flyer announces a nationwide gathering on Veterans Day, aimed at honoring veterans. It highlights a pop-up event in Taos, emphasizing respect and gratitude towards veterans.

title: Resistance Art Show
description: Join us for the opening of the Resistance Art Show — where creativity meets civic power. This event celebrates how the First Amendment protects our right to dissent, protest injustice, and imagine a freer world. Experience art that speaks truth to power — and help us plan our next bold act of public resistance.
raw_text:
RESISTANCE ART SHOW
OPENING: SUN, NOV 16, 7 - 9 PM

Join us for the opening of the Resistance Art Show — where creativity meets civic power. This event celebrates how the First Amendment protects our right to dissent, protest injustice, and imagine a freer world. Experience art that speaks truth to power — and help us plan our next bold act of public resistance.

YANT ART SPACE
72-50 AUSTIN STREET
FOREST HILLS NY 11375

QUEENS SAYS NO KINGS
raw_summary: The image is promoting an art show opening titled "Resistance Art Show," occurring on November 16 from 7 to 9 PM. It discusses themes of civic power and protest art, and the location is Yant Art Space, Forest Hills, NY.

title: Remove the Regime
description: Join us for a series of congressional visits, a rally, and a march in Washington, D.C., featuring live entertainment by The Dropkick Murphys. The event aims to advocate for impeachment and removal.
